meta.videoTitle: Controlling Sugar Cravings & Metabolism with Science-Based Tools

title_en: Subconscious Sugar Circuits, Hidden Sugars in Food
title_zh: 潜意识中的糖分回路，食物中隐藏的糖分

paragraphList.text_en: The intricate workings of the subconscious sugar circuits and the presence of hidden sugars in foods shed light on the complex mechanisms that influence our cravings and food preferences. Understanding these processes is crucial in order to navigate our dietary choices in a way that aligns with our health goals.
paragraphList.text_zh: 潜意识中糖类回路的复杂运作和食物中隐藏糖的存在揭示了影响我们渴望和饮食偏好的复杂机制。了解这些过程对于在符合我们的健康目标的饮食选择中游走至关重要。

paragraphList.text_en: When we consume something sweet, our brain initiates a cascade of reactions that drive us to seek out more of that sweet substance. The conscious pathway for sugar perception leads us to crave sweet tastes, while the post-ingestive reinforcing properties of sugar operate below our conscious awareness. These properties are driven by events in our stomach that compel us to seek out sweet-tasting foods and those that elevate blood glucose levels, regardless of their actual taste.
paragraphList.text_zh: 当我们消费甜食时，我们的大脑会引发一系列的反应，驱使我们寻找更多这种甜味物质。对于糖的感知的意识途径会让我们渴望甜味，而糖的摄入后强化特性则在我们的意识之下运作。这些特性由我们的胃部发生的事件驱使我们寻找甜味食物以及那些提高血糖水平的食物，而不受它们实际味道的影响。

paragraphList.text_en: Research experiments, such as those conducted on animals and humans, demonstrate the influence of these subconscious circuits on our food preferences. For instance, eliminating the ability to sense sweetness in foods diminishes the preference for sugary solutions initially, but this preference often returns after around 15 minutes. This phenomenon underscores that while sweetness plays a part in our preference for sugary foods, there are other underlying factors at play, such as the post-ingestive effects on our bodies.
paragraphList.text_zh: 研究实验证明了潜意识心理回路对我们的食物偏好的影响，例如在动物和人类身上进行的实验。例如，消除食物中甜味的感知能力会在一开始减少对甜食溶液的偏好，但这种偏好通常在大约15分钟后会恢复。这一现象强调了，尽管甜度在我们偏好甜食中起着一定作用，但还有其他潜在因素在起作用，比如食物摄入后对我们身体的影响。

paragraphList.text_en: Neuropod cells in our gut play a pivotal role in this process by responding to the presence of sugars and sending signals to the brain through the vagus nerve. These signals trigger dopamine pathways within the mesolimbic reward pathway, reinforcing our inclination towards sweet foods. Hidden sugars, strategically added to foods to enhance their palatability, can trigger these neuropod cells and dopamine pathways, prompting us to consume more food, even if the sweetness is not perceptible.
paragraphList.text_zh: 神经节细胞在我们的肠道中通过对糖分的存在做出反应，并通过迷走神经向大脑发送信号，在这一过程中发挥着关键作用。这些信号会触发多巴胺通路，加强我们对甜食的倾向。隐藏的糖分被有策略地添加到食物中，以增加它们的可口程度，可以触发这些神经节细胞和多巴胺通路，促使我们摄入更多的食物，即使甜味并不明显。

paragraphList.text_en: Understanding these subconscious mechanisms enables us to comprehend the intensity of our cravings and the challenges associated with resisting certain foods. It highlights the innate processes ingrained in our biology that can make it challenging to resist indulging in sweet or palatable foods. By acknowledging the existence of these subconscious pathways, individuals can begin to take steps to regulate their cravings and make informed dietary choices that support their well-being.
paragraphList.text_zh: 理解这些潜意识机制使我们能够理解我们的渴望强度以及与抵制某些食物相关的挑战。它突显了根植于我们生物学中的固有过程，这些过程可能会使我们难以抵抗沉溺于甜食或可口的食物。通过承认这些潜意识途径的存在，个人可以开始采取措施来调节他们的渴望，并做出明智的饮食选择，以支持他们的健康。
